message: @Inc82 Not yet, but in a near future i will

I work with a startup that primarily telecommutes with one employee in the Netherlands and another in the Philippines.  I thought it'd be a great idea to get a telecommuting incubator / communal office space together, so I made this up:  http://www.dotincubate.com .. is this something others might be interested in?  Curious about the level of interest out there for this type of thing..
@Pellegrino, That's good to know.  Do you yourself have a startup that you telecommute with?
As a brazilian startup enthusiast, that is a really neat idea
i know some people that might be interested in something along those lines
@Pellegrino.. point anyone you think might be interested to this conversation or to the website.. I'd be curious to talk to them about.  Thanks ;)
I find this interesting as well!
@danparsons and @keoz - Well that's good.. seems to be a valid idea.. now I'm just curious if there are teams out there who would be willing to commit to it.. probably would need some press

so basically you're splitting the sococo.com fees but also with the view of having regular team meetings to bounce ideas around/get feedback?

how do you plan to handle ip ownership issues?

As for IP Ownership, I don't see that as a problem.  I think that comes down to having the right mixture of teams taking part, ones that have the same goals but aren't competing with each other.   Certainly really private information would only be shared in the privacy of ones online office where others don't have access..  as for stuff that comes up in group discussions.. I don't really see any IP issues there..  It's good to get things "out there" anyways..
How would you normally handle IP issues when you work down the hall from someone?

@deancollins - Certainly offline office rental can be expensive, particularly in cities, so a communal workspace makes both economic sense not withstanding the additional value of the cross pollinating environment.  Online 'real estate' is cheap, however, so the idea of creating the collaborative space is not to reduce fee's, but rather to create that same type of incubating environment for those who may otherwise not have that chance.
@deancollins, do you have a startup that you are currently telecommuting with?
